data.text:
When Leola Thompson was born on 27 March 1875, in New Hebron, Lawrence, Mississippi, United States, her father, Wiley Warner Thompson, was 28 and her mother, Mariah Annette Stephens, was 23. She married George Harmon Matthews on 12 February 1899, in Lawrence, Mississippi, United States. They were the parents of at least 2 sons and 2 daughters. She lived in Beat 4, Lawrence, Mississippi, United States in 1880 and Beat 2, Copiah, Mississippi, United States for about 30 years. She died in 1958, in Copiah, Mississippi, United States, at the age of 83, and was buried in Wesson, Copiah, Mississippi, United States.

Do you know Leola? Do you have a story about her that you would like to share? Sign In or Create a FREE Account

1876 Â· The First Worlds Fair in the U.S.

The First official World's Fair, was held to celebrate the 100th anniversary of the signing of the Declaration of Independence in Philadelphia. 37 Countries provided venues for all to see.

1877 Â· Mississippi State Board of Health is Created

In 1877, the Mississippi State Board of Health was established to protect and advance health throughout the state. There are several different categories that fall under their watch such as disease, environment, injury, standard care, shots, keep records, and more.

1898 Â· War with the Spanish

After the explosion of the USS Maine in the Havana Harbor in Cuba, the United States engaged the Spanish in war. The war was fought on two fronts, one in Cuba, which helped gain their independence, and in the Philippines, which helped the US gain another territory for a time.
